archimate:Capability.name: Black Listing Filtering
archimate:Capability.documentation: Blacklisting is a form of filtering where a list is created that registers entities that are prohibited access or are unwelcome signatures. When a blacklist is used, the default is to 'permit all' except for those entries that are enumerated in the filter. These are typically used when it is easier (and therefore a shorter list) to determine what entities should not be allowed.
